thread.title: Laughs aplenty at Dead Funny Christmas
thread.title_full: Laughs aplenty at Dead Funny Christmas

title: Laughs aplenty at Dead Funny Christmas
text:
Laughs aplenty at Dead Funny Christmas John Burls | 2nd Oct 2015 3:30 PM Billionaire Noonan Tinburn (Luke Lanham) shows fiancee, Pru Slade (Rita Walker) one of his banks. Contributed Local Real Estate Cars For Sale 
WHILE billionaire Noonan Tinburn truly believed it was better to cry in a Rolls-Royce than cry in a bus, he nonetheless yearned to be like other people and to this end he even tried to register at Centrelink, but was knocked back. 
In desperation, he offered to buy Centrelink and then register, but Centrelink said it wasn't a good idea. 
It would look too much as though he was getting special treatment. 
In A Dead Funny Christmas, Noonan, played by Luke Lanham, is not quite sure how, but he's become engaged to Pru Slade, played by Rita Walker. Pru set her sights on Noonan because she wanted money and the listening bank had refused to listen and the bank which likes to say yes, had said no. 
This is just a fragment of the back story to these two characters, in The Indee's November, pre-Christmas, comedy. 
A Dead Funny Christmas will feature two Saturday night dinner-shows, plus two Friday evening and two Sunday matinee non-dining shows. 
Show dates are 6pm for 6.30 (dinner shows) both Saturdays (November 14 and 21), 7.30pm Friday (13 and 20) and 2pm Sunday (15 and 22). 
Tickets, dinner and show are $42, with groups of eight or more $39, Indee members $37, Fridays $25, concessions $23 and members $20. 
Phone 5472 8200 for tickets. dead funny christmas
